intro: Trophis glabrata, commonly known as the smooth trophis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
